snippet: A lawyer for Xing Wu Pan, a former top fund-raiser for John C. Liu, the New York City comptroller, said he would seek to have the charges against his client dismissed.
abstract: Attorney for Xing Wu Pan, former top fund-raiser for New York City Comptroller John C Liu, is seeking a dismissal of legal charges against Pan, claiming government misconduct; Pan, charged with funneling illegal campaign contributions to Liu through fictitious donors, alleges that the government pressured him to help manufacture a case against Liu in investigations of the comptroller's fund-raising practices.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and DAVID W. CHEN

lead_paragraph: A lawyer for Xing Wu Pan, a former top fund-raiser for John C. Liu, the New York City comptroller, said he would seek to have the charges against his client dismissed.

headline.seo: Lawyer Says Government Tried to ‘Manufacture’ Case Against Liu
headline.main: Lawyer Alleges U.S. Misconduct in Effort to Charge City Comptroller
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Alleges U.S. Misconduct in Effort to Charge City Comptroller
